turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Before you jump to conclusions, the man in the picture, COTTON WEARY, is out of the country on business. His alibi checks out. Seems he's got a TV show in Australia, 100% COTTON. It's supposedly the biggest thing down under since Yahoo Serious, but that's besides the point.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: What does this have to do with Sid?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Who knows more about Maureen Prescott than her own daughter?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Well Sid's dad couldn't help you and he was married to Maureen.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Is that a threat, Detective?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: When it's a threat, you'll know it.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Is that a threat?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Detective Kincaid?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: What Rielly?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: There's someone here who wants to help.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Nice to finally meet you, Sidney.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: The killer called her.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: What?  When?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Sidney, do you have any idea how he could've gotten your number?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: He could've monitored the calls on a scanner. Did you call her from the set?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Jesus Christ Sidney, what happened? I got a call on my cell from home. They told me that someone was attacked.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: And what made you think it was Sidney?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE KINCAID
turns.text: Sid, get in my car. You're coming back to the station with me where it's safe.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: What are you doing here? I told you to stay hidden! It's not safe for you up here.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Well it's not safe for me up there either. The killer found me Dewey. He called me last night.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I figured I'd be safe If I was at least up here with the people I care about.  Now where's this Kincaid guy the news is talking about? I found this place from a FOX 5 TV NEWS REPORT. Heh.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Follow me.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I was afraid they were bait, something to, ya know,  trick you out of hiding.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Listen, Detective, I wanna see this studio where all this shit's going down.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Alright Sid, over there is the STAB 3 Production offices. That's where Sarah Darling was murdered last night.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Mm, what a waste of Silicone.  What does my mother have to do with this all Dewey? We're a long way from Woodsboro.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Karen Colcheck. From Woodsboro.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: She was Randy's only girlfriend . . . ever.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I can see nothing's changed.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Listen Dewey I have to go to the bathroom.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Do you want me to come with you Sid? I mean, remember what Randy said?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No I'll be ok. I've got my mace. My knife.  These two lethal weapons.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Don't worry, I've got a permit for it.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Jesus Christ Dewey help me! They tried to kill me in the bathroom! The killers!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Help me Sid! The killer's got me!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Dewey?! OHMIGOD! Where are you?!

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Sid I can see you!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Where are you Dewey?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I'm out back. Tied up. Hurry Sid! The killer's looking for you! Quick untie me!

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Where's Gale?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: They've got her!

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Sid I want you to stay here! I'll be right back! I'm not gonna let them get Gale!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Dewey my God I thought you were dead.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Don't worry Sid I'd never leave you like that.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: DEWEY! IT'S GALE!

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Watch out Sid. Randy said the killer's always superhuman.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: He wasn't superhuman Dewey. He wasn't superhuman at all.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Dewey, personal lives and pasts aside, this is about Sidney. We need to know where she is.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: What so you can just exploit her again with another book? Sid doesn't need you Gale.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Show him.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: They found another note?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Uh-huh. Another News clipping. Another one about Sid's mom. Dewey, whether we like it  or not it looks like we're going to have to  go back into our past.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: You mean OUR past as in Me and Sid. This has nothing to do with you Gale.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: This has everything to do with me Dewey. I was the one who brought the nation's attention to this shit anyway. I'll be damned if I'm gonna sit around and pass on the buck again.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Do you really mean it this time Gale?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Yes. Look, let's get something straight Dewey, I got into this shit cause the police came looking for ME. Not cause I'm out to make the SUNRISE STUDIOS SLASHINGS.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Why would the police come to you?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Again, I am the author of the definitive book on the Woodsboro murders.!  What about you?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: What about me?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: You said you'd never leave Woodsboro, 'The only place that's real!'  But now you're here. Not with me.  Dewey, I took care of you.  I waited until you were well.  I couldn't stay there, I mean, it's like dog years, one year in Woodsboro is like seven everywhere else.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: So it's off to London for a week?  New York for a month? L.A Forever?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: It was fucking '60 Minutes II'!  I couldn't say no!  I could've been the next Diane Sawyer!

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: What's wrong with just being Gale Weathers? I liked her!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: It didn't work Dewey.  We tried,  we're different.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: You used to say that was our strength.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Dewey, you're not just here because of that second rate K-Mart, straight-to-video version of me, are you?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Brace yourself, Gale, all of this is actually not About you.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: All of what Dewey?  You do know something, don't you?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Off the record.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Always.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Two months ago, the Woodsboro police got a call from a woman who said she was with 'Stab 3'.  She wanted to see the file on Sid, for research.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: The boys said no.  She wouldn't give her name. A month later, the station gets broken into, the file room ransacked.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Someone stole Sid's file?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I already removed it.  I think someone on the film was trying to find Sid, and that's the only reason I came here. To make do a little private investigating of my own and make sure no one here was planning anything.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I'm sorry, this is too good!

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: What part of 'Off the record' don't you understand?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Right. Sorry.  Do you think he did it?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I've got my suspicions but still, nothing  you say can ever make me take my eyes off one person.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: And who is that?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Jennifer needs me.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Jennifer?! Wait, where are you going off to?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I'm on duty.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Stop following me.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I happen to work for the police god dammit!

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: You're not a detective.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Neither are you, Magnum P.I.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Gale, your engine's still running.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Fuck!

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Don't worry. I'm prepared for anything.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Amen boy scout, now answer the fucking door!

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: OH. OH GOD. GALE --

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: GALE BEHIND YOU!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Sid, this is detective Kincaid.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Do you have her number stored in your memory?  Phone memory!

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Oh.  Yeah, I guess I do.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Has anyone else every used your phone?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Just Jennifer.  And you.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I've got an idea, I'll hook up with you guys later.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Do you want us to come with you?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I work better alone.  Why don't you do some snooping around the set?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Sidney, what happened?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Nevermind, what'd you two find?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Paternity test results. Christ Dewey, you're never going to believe who Milton's kid is.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Gale, I know this is a bad time and all but what if we try it out again. The whole relationship thing.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Sure, why not. You did Save my life,Mr. Rielly.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: So you knew Sidney Prescott's mother.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Just what the hell do you people think you're doing, barging in here like this? I've got important calls to make. I run this studio.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: What's your point?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: No point, I'm just gonna give Detective Kincaid a call.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: I remember her!  She was a bit player in a couple of my movies. A nobody! So what does it matter?

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: What the hell are you guys getting at?  I make horror films, that's what I do.  The Studio came to me with 'Stab'.  They came to me, check it out.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: But you know who she was.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: When we did the first 'Stab" I realized I'd known Maureen Prescott before, I mean as Rina. I couldn't tell anyone.  Can you imagine the press?

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: Good morning Gale. Pleasure to be here.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: It's a pleasure to finally meet you, Roman.

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: Well it's a honor to be here amongst so many fans of the genre. And I must say that any of you worried that Jerry Rapp, or Tori or David not returning to complete the STAB trilogy, have no fear, Roman is here. Aided with my excellent cast of newcomers I believe we're going to pull off one of the best Stabs yet.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Roman, from your enthusiasm it certainly seems that way.  Honestly though,  tell us, what's	your favorite scary movie?

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: Honestly, my life.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Your life?

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: Well if you were in my shoes, dealing with those big Time Sunrise Studio producers like I do on a daily basis, you'd watch how quick your life goes from a Walt Disney picture to a Tobe Hooper flick.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Would you excuse me for a moment?

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You! How can I ever get any fame playing you!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Dewey, what the hell is she rambling about now? What's wrong Jen, see yourself on one of those USA NETWORK winners you did and realize how badly you suck at acting?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: God damn you Gale Weathers! Don't you see? The killer is choosing  his victims as they die in the script! Ben Damon's character was the first one to get offed. So was his girlfriend - but she wasn't cast yet so his real girlfriend was killed - then Sarah Darling's Candy, and now me!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Wait a second, whoa! Calm down! Number one there were five different versions of the script given out. Ben Damon was given a fake script because he was only being offered the role. It only had fragments of real scenes from the actual script. And what, I die in STAB 3?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: AND I DIE NAKED?!  UGH! This is complete bullshit. Who wrote this piece of crap?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I know right. It was kinda weak. That's cause Will Kennison only wrote a rough treatment of it. The script was written by some new guy. He wrote Arlington Street.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Still that was a much better movie, I saw it at the premiere last week. God, what the hell am I getting sidetracked with this shit for?! We've gotta get down to business.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Shit! Where the hell are Tom and Angelina?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I don't know. Screw them. Look, what's important is that we stick together. No matter what. If anyone is next it's you or me Jen.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Who's phone?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Oh shit it's my cell!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Listen you sick bastard, what the fuck do you want?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What's your favorite scary movie Gale?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I dunno but I can tell you that your's will be the home video footage of me sticking my foot up your ass! Now come out and fight like a real man you pussy!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: God damn it you two! Run! Hurry! He's dead!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: No! He's not dead! He's still breathing! Look!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Geez.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What the hell are you doing?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Being Gale Weathers.  What the hell are you doing?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I am Gale Weathers!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Here's how I see it.  I've got no house, no movie, no gun, and I'm being stalked.  Because someone wants to kill me?  No, because someone wants to kill you. So now, starting now, I go where you go.  That way, if someone wants to kill me, I'll be with you, and since they really want to kill you, they won't kill me, they'll kill you.  Make sense?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: None.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You know in the movies, I play you as being much smarter.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: And as a sane person.  For you that must be quite a stretch.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: That's funny.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Ha. Maybe I should join SNL.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Need to get in that building?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: No really?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: There a story in that building?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Possibly.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Gale Weathers would find a way.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Basements creep me out.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Really, you know you'd make a fascinating interview. Lifestyles of the Rich and Psychotic.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Look who's talking Moneybags. You got more homes than I do.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Oh I wish I got that one on tape. It'd put a smile on my face everytime I'm down.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Bitch.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Nobody said she was an actor.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Good twist.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Oh, Come on!  You have made millions off the story of her murder.  You're obsessed with HER and you're obsessed with her DAUGHTER!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Settle down Beavis.  Why don't you tell us the truth?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I think Milton's the killer. I think he just went out to kill another cast member.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Milton's not a killer. He's a pervert. He probably went out to buy more KY JELLY for his jack -off parties he has with his two best friends.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Rob Reiner and Quentin Tarentino?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Do you get any of my witty humor? I mean, you did play me for three movies.  His two hands, dingus.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Excuse me Detective, I think we have some business to attend to.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: GALE WEATHERS?! What are you doing here? No press on the set!  No press, no press on set! Get that woman out of here.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Well then, I guess I'll be leaving then.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Oh come on! Why the hostility?

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Listen Lois Lane, I love your show and all but last month I happened to catch your little segment on me and how my wife left me because I'm a sex addict who enjoys screwing fifteen year old girls. It was a real eye opener my lawyers are still thinking about bringing to your superior's attentions.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: They're the ones who approved it.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Answer the question. You knew Sidney's mom?

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: And now? I mean, murders on your set and still you say nothing?

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Get real, that would make me a suspect!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Just because you knew her?

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I don't think so!  Just what happened to Maureen when she was in Hollywood?

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Now you listen to me, Lois Lane, let it go. It's dead and buried. Daddy took ol' Yeller out behind the barn and shot him in the head a long time ago.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Well how would you like his rotten carcass dug up and drug all over National TV? Why don't you start talking.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: It was in the 70's, everything was different. I was well known for my parties, Rina knew what they were. It was for girls like her to meet men, men who could get them parts, if they made the right impression.  Nothing happened to her that she didn't invite, in one way or another, no matter what she said afterwards.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Are you saying she was-

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: I'm saying things got out of hand.  Maybe they did take advantage of her!.  Maybe the sad truth is, this is not the city for innocence.  No charges were brought.  And the bottom line is, Rina Reynolds wouldn't play by the rules.  You wanna get ahead in Hollywood, you gotta play the game, or go home.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Gale Weathers. What a surprise.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Tom Prinze, tanked as usual. That's a shocker.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Hey I really liked that piece you did on me last month. The one where you said my car accident was caused by me drinking and drugs, and how I faked the tire blow-out just so my insurance wouldn't sky rocket.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Heh, well, that's TV journalism for ya. Stage the news to boost ratings.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Really, cause that stunt lost me the lead role in Roman Polanski's latest picture. Huh, what a coincide I was picked up by Roman Bridger. Well, not exactly the Roman I wanted. Get my point? STAB 3 is bullshit. Fuck, because of your big mouth I'm here, drinking piss water SCOTCH with Second rate fucking celebrities like Jennifer Jollie and yourself!  Hey, I just got an idea. Maybe I should Have a look at your break line. That your car over there?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I think we should go inside. I have to have a talk with the cast. ALL OF YOU.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You mean what's left of us.  Yeah I'm running on empty anyways. Gotta refuel.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Oh my God! Sidney, you ran fast or what?  Hey.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Hi, Gale. I'm glad you're all right.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What'd he say?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Oh, you know, the usual small talk, "What's new, how ya been, how do you want to die?"

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Oh my God Karen you scared the shit out of me! What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Who's this.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: We did some researching in the archives. Sid, something dawned on me when I wrote the book on your mother's murder. For two years of her life, 1969 up until 1971 she basically disappeared off the face of the Earth.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Gale he's got Dewey!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I know! He killed Kincaid!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I know!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Let's get out of here!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: GALE WATCHOUT!

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: Roman Bridger, director. And brother.  She slammed the door in my face, Sid. Said I was Rina's child and Rina was dead. And it struck me, what a good idea! So I watched her, made a little home movie, a little family film. Seems Maureen, mom, really got around. I mean, Cotton Weary was one thing, everybody knew about that, but Billy's father, that was the key! Your boyfriend didn't like seeing his daddy in my movies. Didn't like it at all. And once I supplied the motive, all the kid needed was a few pointers. Have a partner to sell out in case you get caught, find someone to frame, it was like her was making a movie.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: All the nightmares. All the hell I went through was because of you, you spineless bastard!

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: I'm a director Sid, I direct. For example, Angelina over there,  She's my partner. I can convince her to do anything.  We've been dating since I met her in Woodsboro.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Oh my God, Angie Crick? From English class?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Listen, I have no time for this. I've heard this shit before! So lets get on with it!

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: Wait a second Sid. Don't you go jumping the gun. You haven't seen the best part.  With the aides of the computer revolution of y2kI've been able to steal your voice.  Ain't it cool? Listen to what the police are gonna find next to your lifeless, mutilated body.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I can't take it anymore. This Hollywood exploitation of the nightmare I lived has to be stopped. I did this to make you all repent for your sins, and now I'm pleased I've got my message across. Good-bye.

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: See Sid, now comes the part where we get away with it! The part where we win! Cause face it Sidney, in this world, the bad guys win!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Roman knock it off! Do you people even know why you kill people? You kill people cause you choose to and not because of any other fucking reason!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Oh shit.  Hello? Director's office.

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: Sarah, it's Roman, I'm sorry I'm running late, I'm still on the 405, I'm about 10 minutes away.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Oh it's no problem, I'm just... looking at your   music video awards.

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: All right, since I got you on the phone, let's talk about your character.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What character?  I'm Candy, the chick who gets killed second.  I'm only in two scenes!

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: You're not happy with your part.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I'm not happy that I'm 35 playing a 21 year old. I'm not happy that I have to die naked!  And I'm not happy that my character is too stupid not to have a gun in the house after her boyfriend's been cut into McNuggets.

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: Um hmm...  umhmm great, so let's run the lines.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Huh, fine.

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: Page 22, Candy's big moment.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Page 22..  Ring ring.  Hello?

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Who's this?

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: Who's this?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: This is Candy.  Hang on, let me get some clothes. See!  I don't' understand why I have to start the scene in the shower!  The whole shower things been done, 'Vertigo' hello!  And I mean, my boyfriend just died, why am I showering?

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: Why don't we just read the scene?  Candy, is that like candy cane or candy apple?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Whatever.  Come on, who is this?  I think you have the wrong number.

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: But you know my favorite name?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I'm hanging up right now.

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: It's Sarah.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Roman that's not the line.

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: It is in my script.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Has there been another goddamn rewrite? How  the fuck are we supposed to learn our lines when there's a new script every 15 minutes?

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: It's not just a new script, it's a new movie.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What?  What movie?

turns.speaker: ROMAN
turns.text: My movie.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Goddamnit I am getting so fed up with these re-writes. It's like every five minutes there's a new script. God, and you just know this all because of STAB 2's script winding up on the internet two months after it wrapped shooting.

turns.speaker: TYSON
turns.text: And still the film is Number One at the box office this weekend. Beat out American Pasty and Arlington Street.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What are you talking about? The murders were a completely isolated incident.

turns.speaker: TYSON
turns.text: SCENE 32. INT. CANDY'S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT. "What are you talking about Ricky, the murders were a completely isolated incident".

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Would you give that script a rest? It's like a friggen umbilical cord to you.

turns.speaker: TYSON
turns.text: I'm just saying, though. What if there's someone out there stalking actors? Huh? Then what?

turns.speaker: TYSON
turns.text: Roman and everybody else went home for the night. I'm here for a make-up test.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Make-up. You need it.  Hey, Roman isn't here?

turns.speaker: TYSON
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Damn. He called my roommate and told her he had some important things he wanted to go over with me in his office tonight.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Do you think it's over Sidney? Do you?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: W-what do you want?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: I want to finish what I started. I want to finish the game.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You sick fuck I'm tracing this call as we speak! The police are gonna nail your ass!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Let them try. You'll never find me. I've already gotten away with murder before. For instance, Maureen Prescott.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No. You didn't kill my mother. Billy Loomis and Stu Macher did.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Heh. So you think Sidney. So you think. It's all been building up to this Sid. Every STAB. Every SCREAM. Every ounce of blood that's been spilled has all been leading up to this moment. WELCOME TOTHE FINAL ACT.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: The final act? Well let's play asshole!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: No. We play in my court this time. Come to Hollywood. STAB 3's going to cutting corners cast-wise.  And I've got my eyes set on a technical advisor named Dewey Rielly.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: If you lay a hand on him I'll fucking kill you!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Great. A spirited one. I'll be seeing you real soon Sidney. Real soon.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: { a click } I only her you too, Sidney.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: The question isn't who I am.  The question is, who's with me.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Don't do it!  If you do one thing to attract attention, one thing, I'll kill them both. Now, do you have somewhere we can be alone?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Go there.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Always hard being friends with you, Sidney. When you're friends with Sidney, you die! Well these friends don't have to, Sidney. It's up to you.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: How do I know their voices are --

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Are real?  How do you know you're not hearing things? How do you know I'm not someone in your head? Somewhere, you know.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You're dead!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: I don't want them, I want you!  It's simple. You show yourself, they survive, you run, they die!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: She'd have been so happy, Sidney, to know we'd be together.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: WHERE?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: I'll call you, when you're on your way.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: You follow directions good. Now let's wrap this production. Go to the Sunrise Studios backlot. I'll call you when you get there.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Alright, I'm here. Now what?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: You're doing real good. Can't you figure it out? I wanna finish this where it all began. Woodsboro.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I thought you wanted me here?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Alright I'm here, now show your  face so we can finish this.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: It's good to see you again Sidney. I was growing real impatient. Go ahead. Explore. I'll catch up with you later.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Yes, hi I'm Laura, I'm a trained counselor. How can I help you.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Laura I think I just killed somebody.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Uh-huh I'm sure. I've killed someone! OH MY GOD I'VE ACTUALLY KILLED SOMEONE!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Well then the people you need to call are the police.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: No I need to call you. Just you.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I'm sorry, your voice.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Don't you want to know how you can help, Sidney?  Are you listening to me, huh?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Who the fuck is this?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: It's mother, Sidney, now be a good girl and turn on the news. DO IT!

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: What? She asked.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: It's called tact, you fuckrag.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I didn't kill anybody.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: No one's saying you did.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Owwww...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You open your mouth and stupidity pours out.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: How'd you do?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Piece of cake. She'll be there.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Thanks, butt wart. You did good.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: So you gonna try and make up with Sid?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Duh... that's quick.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I was just asking. Why are you always at me?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Because I'm trying to build your self-esteem. You're far too sensitive.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Oh...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You ready to party hard tonight?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: You know it.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Dude. What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I was hoping Sid and I could talk.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Where ya going? It's not over yet. We've got one more surprise -- Stu, I believe it's your turn.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Oh yeah.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: You have to play, Sid. Don't want to disappoint your dad. He's been waiting around all night.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: It's an easy game. We ask you a question. If you get it wrong -- you die.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: And if you get it right -- you die.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Tell that to Cotton Weary. You wouldn't believe how easy it was to frame him.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Yeah, we just watched a few movies. Took a few notes. It was fun.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: And did they really ever explain why Hannibal Lecter liked to eat people? Don't think so. You see, it's scarier when there's no motive, Sid.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Think about it. On the off chance I get caught -- a motive like that could divide a jury for years, don't you think?. You took my mother, so I took yours. Big sympathy factor. Maternal abandonment causes serious deviant behavior. It certainly fucked you up. It made you have sex with a psychopath.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: That's right and now that you're no longer a virgin. You gotta die -- those are the rules.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: This is the best part, Sid. Billy's got it all figured out. Why do you think we kept your father alive so long? Why did we save you for last?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You know what time it is, Sid? It's after midnight. It's your mother's anniversary. We killed her exactly one year ago today.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What if your father snapped? Your mom's anniversary set him off and he went on a murder spree, killing everyone...

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Except for me and Billy... we were left for dead...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: And then he killed you and then shoots himself in the head. It's a perfect ending.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Everyone dies but us. We get to carry on and plan the sequel. Let's face it, these days -- you gotta have a sequel.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: That's it, Billy. I can't take any more. I'm feeling woozy.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Get the gun. I'll untie Pops.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: It's on the table.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: No, it's not.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I thought she was dead.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: She looked dead. Still does.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: She can't get both of us.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Odds are -- she'll miss anyway.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I don't know Billy but I'm hurtin'.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Where the fuck did she go?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: FIND HER YOU DIPSHIT!

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I can't... I'm bad off, Billy. You cut too deep.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: Thank you, Hank. We're on it. What were you doing out at Sidney's tonight?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I just wanted to see her, that's all.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: You rode your bike out there?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: And last night? Sidney said you crawled through her window last night too?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: Did you ride past Casey Becker's house?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: No, I didn't. I didn't kill anyone, Sheriff.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: We're gonna have to keep you, Billy. The governor's got SBI, FBI, and god knows who else on their way down here.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Billy? What the...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I'm sorry. Don't hate me.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You sleep in THAT?
